data.meta_description: Whatâ€™s keeping you from achieving your dream of homeownership? Donâ€™t let myths and misconceptions stand in the way. Read here as we debunk seven commonâ€¦
data.text:
Are you looking for some interior inspiration at home? The growing popularity of design trends like vintage and dopamine dÃ©cor are taking this season by storm. Read here for seven popular home trends this summer: http://spr.ly/6047ioxBc

In June, housing starts jumped 3.0% month-over-month and building permits saw a 3.4% monthly increase. Though both numbers were higher than expected, the increases are largely due to multifamily building. The more hopeful news of the week came from this morningâ€™s comments from Fed members and yesterdayâ€™s National Association of Home Builders (NAHB) housing market sentiment index. What can you expect from the market moving forward? Read here: http://spr.ly/6045i9lLv

Credit report vs credit score-- what do you need to know? Not only are the two different, but they're used for different purposes. Here's a handy chart to help you understand the distinction #CreditReport #CreditScore

When you originate a loan, you will be required to make some initial payments upon your closing: one is the down payment, the other is your closing costs. Closing costs typically include the loan origination fee, appraisal fee, credit report fee, tax service fee, closing/escrow fee, mortgage recording charge, hazard insurance premium/reserves, and county property taxes/reserves, totaling 3-6% of the loan amount #2CentsTuesday

Did you know?? There's CASHðŸ’° trapped inside your home! That's right, it's called home equity and it's the difference between the market value of your home and the amount of your mortgage that you still owe. Here are 5 ways you can leverage your home equity to meet your goals #HomeEquity

Whatâ€™s new in market news? The Federal Reserve (and all those in favor of lower rates) has been keeping a close eye on inflation in recent years, just waiting for it to cool off. This morning, the consumer price index (CPI) gave us the news we wanted. As the CPI revealed cooling inflation levels in June, average mortgage rates fell to a four-month low. Read more: http://spr.ly/60479AwpV

You can remodel the bathroom, renovate the kitchen, paint the exterior, and spruce up the landscaping, but there's one aspect of a home you can't change: LOCATION. When house hunting, be sure to keep location in the forefront of your mind #2CentsTuesday
